page.title: 11THE VILLAGE OF BURITON
page.content: {Clubs:}The village has a Guide Company, Womens Institute,Tennis, Cricket and Boxing Clubs and the Buriton Association. {Ecology:}The Buriton Pond is the start of the South Downs Way. Several other footpaths radiate from the village. Being at the base of the wood covered slope of the Downs, the climate is damp and foggy in winter. {Education:}The Primary School has 49 pupils and 3 staff, including a teaching Headmaster. The catchment area extends from Weston to Nursted. In addition to normal subjects all children are encouraged to play an instrument, generally a recorder, and use a computer. The village recreation field is used for sporting activites. A Mother and Toddler Group runs in the village but there is no Nursery Class.
